Issues.Title: Port the ArrayEditor from the classic framework and add unit test.
Issues.Body: The ArrayEditor is needed to enable runtime designer functionality for the Chart control (WinForms Core DataVisualization).

Issues.Title: Use ApiCompat to eusure public API compatibility with previous releases
Issues.Body:
Eric's feedback in PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/237

> "Use https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/tree/master/src/Microsoft.DotNet.ApiCompat to make sure your assemblies are compatible with desktop. @dreddy-work should have some familiarity with this, I helped him set it up on some of the facades previously on the internal codebase."
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use ApiCompat to eusure public API compatibility with previous releases" (#580)

Issues.Title: Match other converter's validation of CreateInstance in PaddingConverter
Issues.Body:
- First commit has no functional changes - it just extracts `PaddingConverter` to its own file to match coding guidelines for public classes
- Second commit cleanups up the code but does not fix any bugs. The only piece of dead code removed is the check for `if (destinationType == null)` because this is checked in the base constructor and there is a test for this.
- Third PR makes us match other converters (e.g. `ListBindingConverter`) by fixing the `NullRefs` and the `InvalidCastExceptions`, giving us the nice message:
```cs
---- System.ArgumentException : One or more entries are not valid in the IDictionary parameter. Verify that all values match up to the object's properties.
-------- System.InvalidCastException : Unable to cast object of type 'System.Object' to type 'System.Int32'.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR " Match other converter's validation of CreateInstance in PaddingConverter" (#571)

Issues.Title: Position of minimized MDI child changes when maximized and minimized twice
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
In an MDI environment, when we maximize and minimize an MDI child repeatedly for a couple of times, the child form hidden below

**Actual behavior:** 
When we continuously maximize and minimize an MDI child, the vertical position of the child form changed as shown in the following image. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44049406/54174195-4937c980-44ab-11e9-9b99-65e8c9d87fb6.png)


**Expected behavior:**
The position of the MDI child should not be changed. 

**Minimal repro:**
Please find the sample application and the video to reproduce this from the following link.

[Sample and video illustration](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/storage/attachments/57799-sample.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Position of minimized MDI child changes when maximized and minimized twice" (#570)
